question: Which of the following matrices can be solved using np.linalg.solve(A, B)

answers.answer:
A = np.array([[a1, a2, a3], [a2, a3, a4]])
B = np.array([b1, b2, b3])

A = np.array([[a1, a2, a3], [a2, a3, a4], [a3, a4 ,a5]])
B = np.array([b1, b2])

A = np.array([[a1, a2, a3], [a2, a3, a4], [a3, a4, a5]])
B = np.array([b1, b2, b3])

A = np.array([[a1, a2], [a2, a3], [a3, a4]])
B = np.array([b1, b2])

question: If B and X are row vectors, then the expression $b_1 x_1 + b_2 x_2 + b_3 x_3$ can be expressed as

x = np.linspace(1, 5, 3); y = np.array([3, 9, 27])
Y = interp1d(x, y, kind='quadratic', bounds_error=False)
xfit = np.linspace(-1, 8)
print(Y(xfit))

The above code will

answers.answer: Print Y() values for the x-range (-1, 8)
Print Y() values for the x-range (1, 5) and NaN for the rest

question: If the eigenvalues of matrix A are complex, then we can be certain that the matrix A

answers.answer: has all the elements as complex numbers
